entry.title: Introduction to py.test
entry.summary: py.test is one of the most famous testing package in Python, with limitless configuration options and plenty of plugins to cover all situations.
entry.content:
As part of wroc.py #22, the monthly Python meeting in Wrocław, I presented a brief introduction to py.test.

py.test is one of the most famous testing package in Python, with limitless configuration options and plenty of plugins to cover all situations.

In case you would be interested to reproduce the examples showed during this presentation, please visit this GitHub repository or clone it directly with:

git clone https://github.com/filaton/pytest-intro.git

entry.title: Introduction to Travis CI
entry.summary: Travis CI provides perfect integration with GitHub and Slack to provide free continuous integration for many languages.
entry.content:
As part of wroc.py #18, the monthly Python meeting in Wrocław, I presented a brief introduction to Travis Continuous Integration with GitHub.

Travis CI provides perfect integration with GitHub and Slack to provide free continuous integration for many languages.

In case you would be interested to reproduce the examples showed during this presentation, please visit this GitHub repository or clone it directly with:

git clone https://github.com/filaton/basic_travis.git

entry.title: Introduction to PyAudio
entry.summary: PyAudio provides bindings for the famous C library PortAudio and allows playing and recording audio in realtime with Python.
entry.content:
As part of wroc.py #18, the monthly Python meeting in Wrocław, I presented a brief introduction to to PyAudio package.

PyAudio provides bindings for the famous C library PortAudio and allows playing and recording audio in realtime with Python.

In case you would be interested to reproduce the examples showed during this presentation, please visit this GitHub repository or clone it directly with:

git clone https://github.com/filaton/PyAudio-Introduction.git
